text:
JMeter has a major shortcoming which makes it impossible to use for most 
dynamic HTML application. If a servlet generates an HTML page it often will 
place parameters and elements that are dependent on previous user choices. For 
example, it may put a button or a link with a dynamically generated name. In 
order to simulate the user actions JMeter needs to "press" the button to submit 
the page. However, because the button name and id are not known at the test 
writing time it makes it impossible to write a test. 

Possible solutions are either a simple scripting language or a configuration 
element that will iterate/filter HTML tags and will allow to store values in 
test variables. Then the variable can be used as a parameter to a POST request.
